description: This course is a critical history of the arts and architecture of the Indian sub-continent from the arrival and integration of Islamic religious beliefs and practices and Turko-Persian culture to its renegotiation in the present. The multicultural civilization of the Indian sub-continent had already evolved through several thousand years, and its art became more complex and diverse as a new strand entered and interacted with this pre-existing culture. This course introduces the range of artistic production in South Asia in relation to the multiple strands that have enriched and sustained the cultural fabric of the sub-continent.
name: Art and Narrative in Mughal India

section.name: Art and Narrative in Mughal India

values.name: Art and Narrative in Mughal India
